1063.question: What is the performance change of the textual semantic similarity task when no error and maximum errors (noise) are present?

5-Figure5-1.png: The performance of the textual semantic similarity task decreases as the percentage of error (noise) increases. When there is no error, the correlation is high, with a value of 0.65 on the STS-B dataset. However, when the maximum errors are present, the correlation drops to 0.19, indicating a significant decrease in performance.

1063.answer:
10 Epochs: pearson-Spearman correlation  drops  60 points when error increase by 20%
50 Epochs: pearson-Spearman correlation  drops  55 points when error increase by 20%

1064.question: Which sentiment analysis data set has a larger performance drop when a 10% error is introduced?

4-Figure3-1.png: The data set on the right (Figure 3) has a larger performance drop when a 10% error is introduced, as indicated by the decrease in F1 score.
4-Figure4-1.png: The data set on the right (Figure 4) has a larger performance drop when a 10% error is introduced, as indicated by the decrease in F1 score.
